intro: Gypsophila sphaerocephala var. syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian globeflower, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Syria and Turkey. It belongs to the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its compact, globular inflorescence composed of numerous small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its delicate appearance and ability to withstand dry conditions. The species is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
